question:
You would like to buy some electrical goods at a shop in a town which is far from your home.

Write a letter to the manager of the shop. In your letter:

say which electrical goods you want
ask questions about the cost of the goods and how to pay
explain how you will collect the goods.
Write at least 150 words.

You do NOT need to write any addresses.

Begin your letter as follows:

Dear...
text: I am writing to enquire if you possibly have some electronic items that I need to purchase. I have tried to find these in the shops in my city. However, the options here are very limited and I have not been able to find what I need.

The items what  I need are an external Blu-ray drive, preferably Sony, and a Smartphone with a 12 megapixel camera. I am additionally looking for a printer which combines copying and scanning functions. I would also like to know if it is possible to pay online with PayPal or by telephone with a credit card, or if I can pay when I pick up the goods. Once you confirm these items are available, could you please keep them for me at the shop as I would like to collect them in person when I visit the town next week.
I would really appreciate it if you could reply to my enquiry as soon as possible.

error_list.error_des: It seems that there is a pronoun problem here.
It appears that 12 megapixel is missing a hyphen. Consider adding the hyphen(s).
Consider using a question mark to signify that this sentence is a question.
